elements.name: question1
elements.title: The faster, the better.
elements.correctAnswer: In the sentence "The faster, the better", the subject and the predicate are missing. The complete sentence could read: "The faster you are, the better it is."

elements.name: question2
elements.title: I've told you that a thousand times!
elements.correctAnswer: The sentence "I've told you that a thousand times!" exaggerates the number of times something has been said. It is unlikely that the person has actually said it a thousand times.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: He doesn't laugh. He doesn't cry. He does not speak.
elements.correctAnswer: He doesn't laugh. He doesn't cry. He does not speak.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: What is the contradiction in the expression "eloquent silence"? What stylistic device is it?
elements.correctAnswer: In the expression "eloquent silence" there is a contradiction between "eloquent" and "silence": silence usually means that nothing is said, while eloquent means that a lot is said. The expression is used to describe a silence that is meaningful despite the absence of words.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: Time is money.
elements.correctAnswer: The phrase "time is money" compares time with money. It means that time is valuable and should not be wasted. It is a figurative paraphrase.
